capability.name: Party Lifecycle Management
capability.definition: This service domain tracks the state of a party relationship with the bank from the initial checks made during the establishment of a new party connection and subsequently maintained as necessary over the duration of the relationship. The checks and the maintenance requirements will vary by party type and jurisdiction. The checks cover bank specific and legal and regulatory considerations and may be updated based on a standard schedule or by request in specific circumstances.
capability.role: This service domain tracks the state of a party relationship with the bank from the initial checks made when establishing a new business relationship with a customer or partner and then that are performed as necessary over the duration of the relationship. The checks and the maintenance requirements will vary by party type (e.g. individual, company, partner) and jurisdiction. The checks cover bank specific and legal and regulatory considerations and may be updated based on a standard schedule or by request in specific circumstances.
capability.example: A prospective customer has been identified and the bank undertakes a collection of checks to confirm this is a new relationship and to verify the relationship in compliance with bank, legal and regulatory requirements. Note that for different customer types (non consumer in particular) many different checks will be required.

key_features.name: Perform party qualification/confirmation checks
key_features.description: Enables perform party qualification/confirmation checks to support this service domain tracks the state of a party relationship with the bank from the initial checks made during the establishment of a new party connection and subsequently maintained as necessary over the duration of the relationship
